newsitem.title: UK: EIB sets six-tranche bond for 36 billion pesetas.
newsitem.headline: EIB sets six-tranche bond for 36 billion pesetas.

text.p: The European Investment Bank (EIB) has launched a six-tranche bond for a total of 36.083 billion pesetas, lead manager Banco Santander de Negocios said.
The first five tranches are linked to the IBEX index, and the last tranche is linked to the MIBOR rate.
The first four tranches are each 5.279 billion pesetas.
Tranche one pays a coupon of 4.30 percent, has a maturity of May 4, 2001 and has a redemption of 90.331 plus 103.658 percent of the increase of the IBEX index.
Tranche two pays a coupon of 4.35 percent, has a maturity of May 7, 2001 and has a redemption of 89.313 plus 108.658 percent of the increase of the IBEX index.
Tranche three pays a coupon of 4.45 percent, has a maturity of May 8, 2001 and has a redemption of 87.276 plus 118.658 percent of the increase of the IBEX index.
Tranche four pays a coupon of 4.50 percent, has a maturity of May 9, 2001 and has a redemption of 86.258 plus 123.658 percent of the increase of the IBEX index.
Tranche five for 10.558 billion pesetas pays a coupon of 4.40 percent has a maturity of May 10, 2001 and has a redemption of 88.294 plus 113.658 percent of the increase of the IBEX index.
The last tranche worth 4.40 billion pesetas pays a coupon of 4.30 percent, has a maturity of May 10, 2001 and has a redemption of 92.89 plus an amount linked to the MIBOR rate.
ISS PRICE 100.10 PAY DATE 10.FEB.97 LONG LAST COUPON
FULL FEES 10 BP MOODY AAA S&P AAA
